# Core Concepts Understanding the fundamental concepts of Vista is essential for building robust applications. This section covers the architecture and design principles that underpin the framework. ## Key Concepts - [VID Overview](/wiki/core/concepts/vid-overview/) - Introduction to the Visual Interface Dialect - [Face Model](/wiki/core/concepts/face-model/) - Understanding faces and facets - [Layout System](/wiki/core/concepts/layout-overview/) - Layout concepts and philosophy - [State Management](/wiki/core/concepts/state-management/) - Managing application state - [Event System](/wiki/core/concepts/event-system/) - Event handling architecture ## Face Model The face model is the foundation of Vista's UI system. Faces are the basic building blocks that represent UI elements with properties, state, and behavior. ## Event System Vista provides a comprehensive event system that allows you to respond to user interactions, from simple clicks to complex gestures. ## See Also - [Components](/wiki/core/components/) - UI components reference - [Tutorials](/wiki/core/tutorials/) - Learning guides
